intro: Crucianella transjordanica, commonly known as the Jordanian sand verbena, is a small annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in coastal or arid environments. The plant features slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in clusters, and bloom from late spring to early summer. It plays a role in stabilizing dunes and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
